div.p: This code system http://tecnomod-um.org/CodeSystem/brain-imaging-type-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: CT + CT Angiography. Use when recorded as a combined protocol and not decomposed into separate procedure entries.
CT + CTA + CT Perfusion. Often used for penumbra/mismatch-based selection in acute stroke.
MRI with DWI and/or FLAIR. Supports imaging-based estimates of lesion age and tissue characterization.
MRI (DWI/FLAIR) + MRA. Represents combined parenchymal and vascular assessment.
MRI (DWI/FLAIR) + MRA + perfusion. Represents advanced tissue and vessel evaluation.

description.value:
This local CodeSystem defines codes for **brain imaging protocol bundles** commonly used in acute stroke, such as CT+CTA+perfusion.
**When to use** - The source system reports the study as a combined protocol (e.g., "CT/CTA/CTP") without individual modality breakdown. - You need a stable code for quality indicators and cohort definitions (e.g., “patients who had CT+CTA+perfusion”).

definition.value: CT + CT Angiography. Use when recorded as a combined protocol and not decomposed into separate procedure entries.
CT + CTA + CT Perfusion. Often used for penumbra/mismatch-based selection in acute stroke.
MRI with DWI and/or FLAIR. Supports imaging-based estimates of lesion age and tissue characterization.
MRI (DWI/FLAIR) + MRA. Represents combined parenchymal and vascular assessment.
MRI (DWI/FLAIR) + MRA + perfusion. Represents advanced tissue and vessel evaluation.
